content.description: Not sure how the "originals" got up, but I choose the less steep/bigger (xxx) fall line.  The other option  looks V6+ and is overhanging with a rough landing (I had no pad). See the topo for details.  Get to the buttress just west of the Toddler.  Take a breath, and leap on to the west face of the Toddler.  This IS A MUST STICK!  Two 5.9+ moves and you summit. See the comments about the enigma on the summit which can be read on the cover page of "The Missing Toddler".   The "exit", is a bit easier, but still, a must make leap to the lower ridge edge to the south.  Perhaps a simo. rap.
content.protection: None.  A pad may help if you do, undone by me, the south side overhang. Tricams and a ladder perhaps?
content.location: On the west side of the Toddler where the face is a bit less than vertical and the erosion pockets are deeper.
